2025-11-17.content:
All Cloud Composer environment's GKE clusters are set up with
**maintenance exclusions** from December 16, 2025 to January 2, 2025. For more
information, see
[Maintenance exclusions](https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/concepts/maintenance-windows-and-exclusions#exclusions).

summary.title: Cloud Composer Maintenance Exclusions
summary.summary: Cloud Composer environments have GKE clusters with maintenance exclusions scheduled from December 16, 2025, to January 2, 2025. This proactive measure ensures service continuity during the specified period.

2025-11-14.content:
You can now
[start Gemini Cloud Assist investigations](https://docs.cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-3/troubleshooting-dags#investigations)
for failed Airflow tasks.

summary.title: Gemini Cloud Assist Investigations for Airflow
summary.summary: Investigate failed Airflow tasks with Gemini Cloud Assist.

2025-11-05.content:
New [Airflow builds](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-versions#images-composer-3)
are available in Cloud Composer 3:

* [composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.19](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-3-airflow-2-10-5-build-19) (default)
* [composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.39](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-3-airflow-2-9-3-build-39)

summary.title: New Airflow builds available for Cloud Composer 3
summary.summary: New Airflow builds are now available for Cloud Composer 3, including the default composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.19 and composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.39.

2025-11-05.content:
Fixed the [CVE-2025-49844](https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2025-49844)
vulnerability. The updated version of the environment component that hosts a
Redis-based task queue is available:

* To apply the fix in Cloud Composer 3, upgrade the Airflow build of your
  environment to airflow-2.10.5-build.19 or airflow-2.9.3-build.39, or later.
* To apply the fix in Cloud Composer 2, upgrade your environment to
  Cloud Composer version 2.15.3, or later.

summary.title: Security Update
summary.summary: Resolved CVE-2025-49844 vulnerability. Update your environment to the latest version to apply the security patch.

2025-11-05.content:
New [images](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-versions#images-composer-2)
are available in Cloud Composer 2:

* [composer-2.15.3-airflow-2.10.5](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-2-15-3-airflow-2-10-5) (default)
* [composer-2.15.3-airflow-2.9.3](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-2-15-3-airflow-2-9-3)

summary.title: New images available for Cloud Composer 2
summary.summary: New images are available for Cloud Composer 2, including composer-2.15.3-airflow-2.10.5 (default) and composer-2.15.3-airflow-2.9.3.

2025-11-05.content:
Resolved an issue in the Kubernetes Pod Operator (KPO) where the Kubernetes
client experienced unreliable connections, leading to occasional failures. The
fix enhances connection stability through the addition of retry logic for
underlying connectivity problems.

summary.title: Kubernetes Pod Operator connection stability improved
summary.summary: Resolved an issue in the Kubernetes Pod Operator (KPO) where the Kubernetes client experienced unreliable connections, leading to occasional failures. The fix enhances connection stability through the addition of retry logic for underlying connectivity problems.

2025-11-05.content:
We strongly recommend to use
[highly resilient environments](https://docs.cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-3/set-up-highly-resilient-environments)
for production use cases. Highly resilient environments provide high
availability and use built-in redundancy and failover mechanisms to reduce the
environment's susceptibility to zonal failures and single point of failure
outages.

summary.title: Highly Resilient Environments
summary.summary: For production use cases, highly resilient environments are recommended. They offer high availability and reduce susceptibility to zonal failures.

2025-10-30.content:
All Cloud Composer environment's GKE clusters will receive
**maintenance exclusions** from November 8, 2025 to December 2, 2025. For more
information, see
[Maintenance exclusions](https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/concepts/maintenance-windows-and-exclusions#exclusions).

summary.title: Maintenance Exclusions for Cloud Composer
summary.summary: Cloud Composer environments will have GKE cluster maintenance exclusions from November 8 to December 2, 2025.

2025-10-30.content:
New [Airflow builds](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-versions#images-composer-3)
are available in Cloud Composer 3:

* [composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.18](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-3-airflow-2-10-5-build-18) (default)
* [composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.38](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-3-airflow-2-9-3-build-38)

summary.title: New Airflow builds available
summary.summary: New Airflow builds are available for Cloud Composer 3, including composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.18 (default) and composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.38.

2025-10-30.content:
The following Cloud Composer versions and builds have reached their
[end of support period](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-versioning-overview#version-deprecation-and-support):
composer-3-airflow-2.7.3-build.21 and composer-2.9.9-\*.

summary.title: Cloud Composer versions deprecated
summary.summary: Certain Cloud Composer versions are no longer supported. This includes composer-3-airflow-2.7.3-build.21 and composer-2.9.9-*. More details can be found in the versioning overview.

2025-10-30.content:
New [images](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-versions#images-composer-2)
are available in Cloud Composer 2:

* [composer-2.15.2-airflow-2.10.5](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-2-15-2-airflow-2-10-5) (default)
* [composer-2.15.2-airflow-2.9.3](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-2-15-2-airflow-2-9-3)

summary.title: New Images Available
summary.summary: New images are available for Cloud Composer 2, including composer-2.15.2-airflow-2.10.5 (default) and composer-2.15.2-airflow-2.9.3.

2025-10-30.content:
*(Cloud Composer 3)* Airflow workers are restarted when they exceed their
storage limit.

summary.title: Airflow workers restart on exceeding storage limit
summary.summary: Airflow workers will now restart automatically when they exceed their storage limit, ensuring uninterrupted operation.

2025-10-30.content:
Fixed an error where Airflow components failed to start up when multiple
objects with the same name were present in the `/dags` or `/plugins` folder in
the environment's bucket.

summary.title: Airflow startup error fixed
summary.summary: Resolved an issue that prevented Airflow components from starting when duplicate object names existed in `/dags` or `/plugins` folders.

2025-10-27.content:
New [images](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-versions#images-composer-2)
are available in Cloud Composer 2:

* [composer-2.15.1-airflow-2.10.5](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-2-15-1-airflow-2-10-5) (default)
* [composer-2.15.1-airflow-2.9.3](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-2-15-1-airflow-2-9-3)

summary.title: New images available for Cloud Composer 2
summary.summary: New images are available for Cloud Composer 2, including composer-2.15.1-airflow-2.10.5 (default) and composer-2.15.1-airflow-2.9.3.

2025-10-27.content:
*(Cloud Composer 2)* Configuration of firewall rules for Private IP
environments now requires allowing egress traffic on port 19090.

summary.title: Firewall rules updated
summary.summary: Configuration of firewall rules for Private IP environments now requires allowing egress traffic on port 19090.

2025-10-22.content:
The default value of the
[`NO_PROXY`](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-3/change-networking-type#proxy-variables)
environment variable now includes the IP address of the environment's cluster
Compute Engine metadata server.

summary.title: Updated NO_PROXY environment variable
summary.summary: The NO_PROXY environment variable now includes the IP address of the environment's cluster Compute Engine metadata server.

2025-10-22.content:
*(Airflow 2.10.5)* The `apache-airflow-providers-cncf-kubernetes` package was
[upgraded to version 10.8.2](https://airflow.apache.org/docs/apache-airflow-providers-cncf-kubernetes/stable/changelog.html).
For changes in other packages, see the
[preinstalled packages changelog](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages).

summary.title: Airflow Kubernetes provider upgraded
summary.summary: The apache-airflow-providers-cncf-kubernetes package has been upgraded to version 10.8.2.

New [Airflow builds](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-versions#images-composer-3)
are available in Cloud Composer 3:

* [composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.17](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-3-airflow-2-10-5-build-17) (default)
* [composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.37](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-3-airflow-2-9-3-build-37)

summary.title: New Airflow builds available
summary.summary: New Airflow builds are now available for Cloud Composer 3, including the default composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.17 and composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.37.

2025-10-22.content:
The following Cloud Composer versions and builds have reached their
[end of support period](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-versioning-overview#version-deprecation-and-support):
composer-3-airflow-2.7.3-build.20, composer-3-airflow-2.7.3-build.19,
composer-2.9.8-\*, composer-2.9.7-\*.

summary.title: Cloud Composer Versions Deprecated
summary.summary: Certain versions of Cloud Composer, including composer-3-airflow-2.7.3-build.20, composer-3-airflow-2.7.3-build.19, composer-2.9.8-\* and composer-2.9.7-\* have reached their end of support.

2025-10-22.content:
New [images](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-versions#images-composer-2)
are available in Cloud Composer 2:

* [composer-2.15.0-airflow-2.10.5](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-2-15-0-airflow-2-10-5) (default)
* [composer-2.15.0-airflow-2.9.3](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-2-15-0-airflow-2-9-3)

summary.title: New images available for Cloud Composer 2
summary.summary: New images are available for Cloud Composer 2, including composer-2.15.0-airflow-2.10.5 (default) and composer-2.15.0-airflow-2.9.3.

2025-10-22.content:
*(Airflow 2.10.5)* The `apache-airflow-providers-google` package was upgraded to version 18.0.0 in Cloud Composer 2 images and Cloud Composer 3 builds.

For more information about changes, see the
[apache-airflow-providers-google changelog](https://airflow.apache.org/docs/apache-airflow-providers-google/stable/changelog.html)
from version 17.2.0 to version 18.0.0.

summary.title: Google provider package upgraded in Cloud Composer
summary.summary: The apache-airflow-providers-google package has been upgraded to version 18.0.0 in Cloud Composer 2 images and Cloud Composer 3 builds.

2025-10-10.content:
*(Cloud Composer 2 versions from 2.12.0 to 2.12.3)* Fixed a problem where
Airflow components in the environment's cluster were running out of ephemeral
storage. This change rolls out gradually over several releases to all regions
supported by Cloud Composer 2.

summary.title: Ephemeral storage issue fixed in Cloud Composer 2
summary.summary: A storage issue affecting Airflow components in Cloud Composer 2 environments has been resolved. This fix addresses problems where components ran out of ephemeral storage.

2025-10-10.content:
New [Airflow builds](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-versions#images-composer-3)
are available in Cloud Composer 3:

* [composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.16](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-3-airflow-2-10-5-build-16) (default)
* [composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.36](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-3-airflow-2-9-3-build-36)

summary.title: Airflow builds updated
summary.summary: New Airflow builds for Cloud Composer 3 are now available.

2025-10-10.content:
New [images](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-versions#images-composer-2)
are available in Cloud Composer 2:

* [composer-2.14.4-airflow-2.10.5](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-2-14-4-airflow-2-10-5) (default)
* [composer-2.14.4-airflow-2.9.3](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-2-14-4-airflow-2-9-3)

summary.title: New Images Available
summary.summary: New images are available for Cloud Composer 2, including composer-2.14.4-airflow-2.10.5 (default) and composer-2.14.4-airflow-2.9.3.

2025-10-10.content:
The following Cloud Composer versions and builds have reached their
[end of support period](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-versioning-overview#version-deprecation-and-support):
composer-2.9.6-\*, composer-3-airflow-2.7.3-build.17,
composer-3-airflow-2.7.3-build.18, composer-3-airflow-2.9.1-build.8, and
composer-3-airflow-2.9.1-build.9.

summary.title: Cloud Composer Versions End of Support
summary.summary: Certain Cloud Composer versions are no longer supported. Please update to a supported version to avoid disruptions.

2025-10-09.content:
[Upgrade checks](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-3/upgrade-environments#upgrade-check)
are now generally available (GA) in Cloud Composer 3 and Cloud Composer 2.

summary.title: Upgrade Checks Now GA
summary.summary: Upgrade checks are now generally available for Cloud Composer 3 and 2.

2025-09-30.content:
The `GCE_METADATA_TIMEOUT` environment variable is changed to reserved. This
change addresses an issue where setting a low timeout value disrupted the
environment's operations that relied on the metadata server.

summary.title: Metadata server timeout is now reserved
summary.summary: The GCE_METADATA_TIMEOUT environment variable has been changed to reserved. This resolves an issue where a low timeout value could disrupt operations reliant on the metadata server.

2025-09-30.content: DAG UI now correctly generates error messages about malformed serialized DAG.

summary.title: Malformed DAGs now show errors
summary.summary: The DAG UI has been updated to correctly generate error messages when encountering malformed serialized DAGs.

2025-09-30.content:
*(Airflow 2.10.5)* The `apache-airflow-providers-google` package was upgraded
to version 17.2.0 in Cloud Composer 2 images and Cloud Composer 3 builds.

For more information about changes, see the
[apache-airflow-providers-google changelog](https://airflow.apache.org/docs/apache-airflow-providers-google/stable/changelog.html) from version 17.1.0 to
version 17.2.0.

summary.title: Airflow package upgraded
summary.summary: The apache-airflow-providers-google package has been upgraded to version 17.2.0.

2025-09-30.content:
*(Airflow 2.10.5)* CloudComposerDAGRunSensor is broken in the
`apache-airflow-providers-google` package version 17.2.0. This package is used
by Cloud Composer versions and builds with Airflow 2.10.5 available in this
release. If your DAGs use this sensor, we recommend you postpone upgrading
until the issue is resolved.

summary.title: Cloud Composer Issue
summary.summary: Cloud Composer 2.10.5 users: CloudComposerDAGRunSensor in apache-airflow-providers-google v17.2.0 is broken. Please postpone upgrades if your DAGs use this sensor.

2025-09-30.content:
*(Airflow 2.10.5)* The `apache-airflow-providers-cncf-kubernetes` package was
[upgraded to version 10.8.0](https://airflow.apache.org/docs/apache-airflow-providers-cncf-kubernetes/stable/changelog.html)
from version 10.7.0. For changes in other packages, see the
[preinstalled packages changelog](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages).

summary.title: Airflow Kubernetes Provider Updated
summary.summary: The apache-airflow-providers-cncf-kubernetes package has been upgraded to version 10.8.0.

New [Airflow builds](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-versions#images-composer-3)

* [composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.35](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-3-airflow-2-9-3-build-35)

summary.summary: New Airflow builds are available for Cloud Composer 3, including composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.15 (default) and composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.35.

summary.summary: New images for Cloud Composer 2 are now available, including composer-2.14.3-airflow-2.10.5 (default) and composer-2.14.3-airflow-2.9.3.

2025-09-30.content:
The following Cloud Composer versions and builds have reached their
[end of support period](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-versioning-overview#version-deprecation-and-support):
composer-2.9.4-\*, composer-3-airflow-2.9.1 builds from build.0 to build.7, and
composer-3-airflow-2.7.3-build.16.

summary.title: Cloud Composer versions deprecated
summary.summary: Certain Cloud Composer versions are no longer supported. Please update to a supported version.

2025-09-11.content:
New [Airflow builds](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-versions#images-composer-3)
are available in Cloud Composer 3:

* [composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.14](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-3-airflow-2-10-5-build-14) (default)
* [composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.34](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-3-airflow-2-9-3-build-34)

summary.title: New Airflow builds available
summary.summary: New Airflow builds for Cloud Composer 3 are now available. The default build is composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.14, and composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.34 is also available.

2025-09-11.content:
New [images](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-versions#images-composer-2)
are available in Cloud Composer 2:

* [composer-2.14.2-airflow-2.10.5](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-2-14-2-airflow-2-10-5) (default)
* [composer-2.14.2-airflow-2.9.3](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-2-14-2-airflow-2-9-3)

summary.title: New images available for Cloud Composer 2
summary.summary: New images are available for Cloud Composer 2, including composer-2.14.2-airflow-2.10.5 (default) and composer-2.14.2-airflow-2.9.3.

2025-09-11.content:
Fixed an issue where values of Airflow configuration options were evaluated
before being set. As a result, the actual value was set to the evaluated result.

summary.title: Configuration options evaluation fixed
summary.summary: An issue where Airflow configuration option values were evaluated before being set has been resolved. The configuration options will now be set to their correct values.

2025-09-11.content:
Fixed Airflow logs not exporting to Cloud Logging because of a GKE version
mismatch between Airflow worker and GKE Control plane nodes.

summary.title: Airflow logs export fixed
summary.summary: The issue preventing Airflow logs from exporting to Cloud Logging has been resolved. This was caused by a GKE version mismatch between Airflow worker and GKE Control plane nodes.

2025-09-03.content:
*(Cloud Composer 2)* Cloud Composer's high availability infrastructure was
enhanced to provide greater resilience against zonal outages. This change rolls
out gradually over several releases to all regions supported by
Cloud Composer 2.

summary.title: Cloud Composer 2 High Availability
summary.summary: Cloud Composer 2 now offers enhanced high availability infrastructure to better withstand zonal outages. This improvement is being rolled out across all supported regions.

2025-09-03.content:
*(Available without upgrading)* Cloud Composer 3 now supports DNS resolution
for
[regional service endpoints](https://cloud.google.com/vpc/docs/regional-service-endpoints).
You can now reach regional service endpoints from
DAGs in your environment. This change is available in Public IP environments
without additional configuration. For Private IP environments, an environment
must be
[connected to a VPC network](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-3/connect-vpc-network)
where private endpoints are configured.

summary.title: Cloud Composer 3 Now Supports DNS Resolution for Regional Service Endpoints
summary.summary: Cloud Composer 3 now supports DNS resolution for regional service endpoints, allowing you to reach them from your DAGs. This feature is available in Public IP environments without extra configuration and in Private IP environments when connected to a VPC network with private endpoints configured.

2025-09-03.content:
You can now check if a Cloud Composer 2 environment's configuration
[is compatible with Cloud Composer 3](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-2/upgrade-environments#major-version-upgrade).
We recommend doing this check before migrating to Cloud Composer 3.

summary.title: Cloud Composer 3 Upgrade Compatibility Check
summary.summary: Check your Cloud Composer 2 environment's configuration for compatibility with Cloud Composer 3 before upgrading.

2025-09-03.content:
New [Airflow builds](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-versions#images-composer-3)
are available in Cloud Composer 3:

* [composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.13](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-3-airflow-2-10-5-build-13) (default)
* [composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.33](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-3-airflow-2-9-3-build-33)

summary.title: New Airflow builds available
summary.summary: New Airflow builds are available for Cloud Composer 3, including the default composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.13 and composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.33.

2025-09-03.content:
New [images](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-versions#images-composer-2)
are available in Cloud Composer 2:

* [composer-2.14.1-airflow-2.10.5](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-2-14-1-airflow-2-10-5) (default)
* [composer-2.14.1-airflow-2.9.3](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-2-14-1-airflow-2-9-3)

summary.title: New images available
summary.summary: New images for Cloud Composer 2 are now available. The default image is composer-2.14.1-airflow-2.10.5, and composer-2.14.1-airflow-2.9.3 is also available.

2025-09-03.content:
The following Cloud Composer versions and builds have reached their
[end of support period](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-versioning-overview#version-deprecation-and-support):
composer-2.9.2-\* and composer-2.9.3-\*.

summary.title: Cloud Composer Versions Deprecation
summary.summary: Certain versions of Cloud Composer, specifically composer-2.9.2-* and composer-2.9.3-*, are no longer supported. This announcement serves as a notification for users of these versions.

2025-08-21.content:
Improved the startup times of Airflow workers for environments that have a
large number of custom PyPI packages installed.

This feature was
[announced previously](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/release-notes#June_02_2025)
and has finished gradually rolling out to all regions supported by
Cloud Composer.

summary.title: Faster Airflow Worker Startups
summary.summary: Airflow worker startup times have been improved, especially for environments with many custom PyPI packages. This enhancement is now available in all supported Cloud Composer regions.

2025-08-21.content:
Airflow UI now shows the correct value of the `[core]dags_folder` Airflow
configuration option.

summary.title: Airflow UI DAGs Folder Value Fixed
summary.summary: The Airflow UI now correctly displays the value of the `[core]dags_folder` configuration option.

2025-08-21.content:
*(Airflow 2.10.5)* The `apache-airflow-providers-google` package was upgraded to version 17.1.0 in Cloud Composer 2 images and Cloud Composer 3 builds.

For more information about changes, see the [apache-airflow-providers-google changelog](https://airflow.apache.org/docs/apache-airflow-providers-google/stable/changelog.html) from version 15.1.0 to version 17.1.0.

summary.title: Airflow providers google package upgraded
summary.summary: The apache-airflow-providers-google package has been upgraded to version 17.1.0.

2025-08-21.content: *(Airflow 2.10.5)* The `apache-airflow-providers-cncf-kubernetes` package was [upgraded to version 10.7.0](https://airflow.apache.org/docs/apache-airflow-providers-cncf-kubernetes/stable/changelog.html) from version 10.6.1. For changes in other packages, see the [preinstalled packages changelog](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages).

summary.title: Airflow Kubernetes provider upgraded
summary.summary: The apache-airflow-providers-cncf-kubernetes package has been upgraded to version 10.7.0.

2025-08-21.content:

[Airflow metrics](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-3/monitor-environments)
to Cloud Composer.

* `composer.googleapis.com/workflow/task/cpu_usage`: percentage of CPU used by
  a task.
* `composer.googleapis.com/workflow/task/cpu_usage`: percentage of memory used
  by a task.

2025-07-23.content:
If your environment uses `dag-factory` package version 0.22, then you might
experience DAG failures in Cloud Composer versions that have
`apache-airflow-providers-cncf-kubernetes` package version 10.4.2 or later. At
the same time, upgrading the `dag-factory` package to version 0.23 might require
you to update your DAG code to make it compatible.

If your environment uses `dag-factory` version 0.22, we recommend to do the
following:

* Temporarily postpone upgrading your environment until you're ready to switch
  to `dag-factory` version 0.23. Last versions of Cloud Composer that support
  version 0.22 are composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.3,
  composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.23, composer-2.13.1-airflow-2.10.5, and
  composer-2.13.1-airflow-2.9.3 released on May 14, 2025.
* When you are ready to upgrade, update your DAGs for compatibility with 0.23.
  We recommend to do this in a development environment first.
  [Install](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-3/install-python-dependencies)
  `dag-factory` version 0.23, then check that your DAGs are parsed and are
  working correctly, and update them if needed. After your DAGs are
  compatible, install `dag-factory` version 0.23 in your production
  environment and transfer the updated DAGs. Your environment can now be
  upgraded to a later version of Cloud Composer or Airflow.
* If your environment is already upgraded to a later version of Cloud Composer
  and you experience problems, then update `dag-factory` to version 0.23 and
  update your DAGs for compatibility with 0.23.

summary.title: DAG Failures with dag-factory v0.22
summary.summary: This announcement provides guidance on potential DAG failures in Cloud Composer when using dag-factory version 0.22 with specific Airflow provider versions. It recommends postponing upgrades or updating to dag-factory version 0.23 with necessary DAG code modifications.

2025-07-17.content: [Highly resilient environments](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-3/set-up-highly-resilient-environments) are now generally available (GA) in Cloud Composer 3.

summary.title: Highly Resilient Environments Now Available in Cloud Composer 3
summary.summary: Cloud Composer 3 now offers generally available highly resilient environments, enhancing the reliability of your workloads.

2025-07-14.content:
We're changing the way we provide support dates for Airflow builds in Cloud Composer 3. Before this change, some Airflow builds had their end of support date listed as "To be announced" until a later Airflow version became available. We're deprecating this approach for all builds that are released after July 01, 2025.

We are now providing support dates that depend on a date when a particular Airflow build was released:

* We are introducing the [standard support period](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-versioning-overview#version-deprecation-and-support) of 12 months after the release date.
* All Airflow builds that didn't have an end of support date when this change was introduced are supported until July 1, 2026. Because of this change, some Airflow builds released before July 1, 2025 are supported for longer than the standard support period.
* All Airflow builds that had their support date shorter than 12 months are now supported for 12 months since the date of their initial release.
* All builds released after July 1, 2025 will use the standard support period.

summary.title: Cloud Composer 3: Updated Airflow Support Dates
summary.summary: We are updating the support dates for Airflow builds in Cloud Composer 3. Starting July 1, 2025, all new builds will have a 12-month standard support period from their release date. Existing builds without a defined end of support date will now be supported until July 1, 2026, with some receiving extended support beyond the standard period.

2025-07-09.content: A new Cloud Composer release has started on **July 9, 2025**. Get ready for upcoming changes and features as we roll out the new release to all regions. This release is in progress at the moment. Listed changes and features might not be available in some regions yet.

summary.title: New Cloud Composer Release
summary.summary: A new Cloud Composer release began on July 9, 2025, and is currently being rolled out to all regions. This release includes new features and changes that may not be available in all regions yet.

2025-07-09.content:
We are gradually rolling out a change that **switches the default version** from Cloud Composer 2 to Cloud Composer 3 in the Cloud Composer API.

In regions where the change is rolled out, a Cloud Composer 3 environment is created by default when a version is not specified in Google Cloud CLI, Cloud Composer API, or Terraform. If you use automation scripts to provision Cloud Composer 2 environments, make sure that you explicitly specify a Cloud Composer 2 version.

In this release, the change is rolling out in the following regions: africa-south1, asia-northeast2, asia-south2, asia-southeast2, europe-southwest1, europe-west10, europe-west12, europe-west8, me-central1, me-central2, me-west1, southamerica-west1, and us-south1.

summary.title: Cloud Composer 3 becomes default
summary.summary: The Cloud Composer API's default environment version is being updated from Cloud Composer 2 to Cloud Composer 3. This change will affect new environments created without a specified version in certain regions. Users relying on Cloud Composer 2 should explicitly select that version in their automation scripts.

2025-07-02.content:
Cloud Composer 1 and Cloud Composer 2 environments with version 2.0.x are **approaching their end of life**. We're planning to deprecate them in the following way:

* Starting **September 15, 2025**, you will no longer be able to create new Cloud Composer 1 environments.
* On **September 15, 2026**, all Cloud Composer 1 and Cloud Composer 2 version 2.0.x environments will reach their planned end of life, and you **won't be able to use them**.

Cloud Composer 2 environments with versions later than 2.1.0 and all Cloud Composer 3 environments are not affected by this deprecation.

We recommend planning
[migration to Cloud Composer 3](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/latest/migrate-composer-1-to-3)
or upgrading your Cloud Composer 2 environments to a later version.

summary.title: Cloud Composer 1 and 2 version 2.0.x end of life
summary.summary: Cloud Composer 1 and version 2.0.x of Cloud Composer 2 are nearing their end of life. You won't be able to create new Cloud Composer 1 environments after September 15, 2025. All Cloud Composer 1 and Cloud Composer 2 version 2.0.x environments will be unusable after September 15, 2026. Please migrate to Cloud Composer 3 or upgrade your existing environments.

2025-06-16.content:
We're planning to phase out the APIs that aren't required by Cloud Composer 3.

* Starting **February 27, 2026**, the following APIs will **become fully detachable**. Deactivating these APIs won't cause the deactivation of the Cloud Composer API:

  + artifactregistry.googleapis.com
  + cloudbuild.googleapis.com
  + container.googleapis.com
  + pubsub.googleapis.com
  + sqladmin.googleapis.com
* Starting **May 27, 2026**, these APIs **will no longer be enabled automatically** when you enable the Cloud Composer API. To create Cloud Composer 2 environments in new projects, the group of detached APIs must be enabled manually.

Existing Cloud Composer 3 and Cloud Composer 2 environments in projects where the Cloud Composer API is already enabled will not be impacted. You can do the following:

* After **February 27, 2026**, if your project has only Cloud Composer 3 environments, then you can manually disable the detached APIs.
* After **February 27, 2026**, if your project has Cloud Composer 2 environments, then we recommend keeping these APIs enabled because disabling them might lead to environment's malfunction.
* After **May 27, 2026**, if you use automation scripts to provision Cloud Composer 2 environments, then make sure that the listed APIs are enabled in addition to the Cloud Composer API.

summary.title: API Sunset for Cloud Composer 3
summary.summary: APIs not required by Cloud Composer 3 will be phased out starting February 27, 2026. Some APIs will become detachable, and after May 27, 2026, they will no longer be automatically enabled with the Cloud Composer API. Existing environments are not impacted, but users should adjust automation scripts and consider the impact on Cloud Composer 2 environments.

2025-06-13.content: Cloud Composer pages in the Cloud Console now support the dark color theme. You can switch to the dark theme on the [Appearance page](https://console.cloud.google.com/user-preferences/appearance) in the Cloud Console.

2025-06-10.content: Cloud Composer version 2.8.2 has reached its [end of support period](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-versioning-overview#version-deprecation-and-support).

summary.title: Cloud Composer 2.8.2 Deprecated
summary.summary: Cloud Composer version 2.8.2 is no longer supported. This version has reached its end of support period. For more information, please refer to the versioning overview.

2025-06-02.content:
Improved the startup times of Airflow workers for environments that have a large number of custom PyPI packages installed.

This change rolls out gradually. In this release, it's available in asia-east1, asia-northeast2, asia-south1, europe-north1, europe-west3, us-east1, us-south1, and us-west2 regions.

summary.title: Faster Airflow worker startup times
summary.summary: We have improved the startup times of Airflow workers, especially for environments that have a large number of custom PyPI packages installed. This enhancement is currently available in asia-east1, asia-northeast2, asia-south1, europe-north1, europe-west3, us-east1, us-south1, and us-west2 regions.

2025-06-02.content: *(Cloud Composer 3)* If a VPC network is attached to an environment, then all DNS addresses accessed by the Airflow components of the environment are resolved using the Cloud DNS configuration of the VPC network. In particular, Airflow workers that execute DAGs will resolve DNS addresses in this way.

summary.title: Cloud Composer 3: VPC Network DNS Resolution
summary.summary: With Cloud Composer 3, Airflow components in an environment will now use the VPC network's Cloud DNS configuration for all DNS address resolutions. This change affects Airflow workers executing DAGs, ensuring consistent DNS resolution within the VPC network.

2025-06-02.content: *(Cloud Composer 3)* All newly created private DNS zones are immediately visible to a Cloud Composer environment. Previously, re-attaching a VPC network was required.

summary.title: Immediate visibility for private DNS zones
summary.summary: Private DNS zones are now immediately visible to Cloud Composer environments, eliminating the need to re-attach a VPC network.

2025-06-02.content: *(Cloud Composer 3)* It's now possible to use [zones with cross-project binding](http://cloud.google.com/dns/docs/zones/cross-project-binding). Before this change, cross-project bound zones weren't supported in Cloud Composer 3.

summary.title: Cloud Composer 3: Cross-project bound zones now supported
summary.summary: Cloud Composer 3 now supports cross-project bound zones, which were previously not compatible.

2025-06-02.content:
*(Cloud Composer 2)* In Cloud Composer versions 2.11.5 and later, log processing is switching to using OpenTelemetry instead of Fluentd.

This change was [announced previously](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/release-notes#May_14_2025) and is gradually rolling out over several releases. In this release, it's available in the following regions: asia-east1, asia-east2, asia-northeast2, asia-northeast3, asia-south2, asia-southeast2, australia-southeast1, australia-southeast2, europe-central2, europe-north1, europe-north2, europe-southwest1, europe-west, europe-west10, europe-west12, europe-west6, europe-west8, europe-west9, me-central1, me-central2, me-west1, northamerica-northeast2, northamerica-south1, southamerica-east1, southamerica-west1, us-east5, us-south1, us-west, and us-west3.

summary.title: Cloud Composer 2: Log Processing Update
summary.summary: Log processing in Cloud Composer has been updated to use OpenTelemetry instead of Fluentd, starting with version 2.11.5. This change is being rolled out gradually across several releases and is now available in specific regions.

2025-06-02.content:
New [Airflow builds](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-versions#images-composer-3) are available in Cloud Composer 3:

* [composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.5](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-3-airflow-2-10-5-build-5) (default)
* [composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.25](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-3-airflow-2-9-3-build-25)

summary.title: New Airflow builds for Cloud Composer 3
summary.summary: New Airflow builds are available for Cloud Composer 3, including the default composer-3-airflow-2.10.5-build.5 and composer-3-airflow-2.9.3-build.25.

2025-06-02.content:
New [images](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-versions#images-composer-2) are available in Cloud Composer 2:

* [composer-2.13.3-airflow-2.10.5](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-2-13-3-airflow-2-10-5) (default)
* [composer-2.13.3-airflow-2.9.3](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/versions-packages#composer-2-13-3-airflow-2-9-3)

summary.title: New Cloud Composer 2 Images Available
summary.summary: New images are available for Cloud Composer 2, including composer-2.13.3-airflow-2.10.5 and composer-2.13.3-airflow-2.9.3.

2025-06-02.content: Cloud Composer version 2.8.1 has reached its [end of support period](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-versioning-overview#version-deprecation-and-support).

summary.title: Cloud Composer 2.8.1 Deprecated
summary.summary: Cloud Composer version 2.8.1 is no longer supported. This version has reached the end of its support period, and users are encouraged to upgrade to a newer, supported version to ensure continued access to updates and security patches.

2025-05-29.content: The [Composer Local Development CLI tool](https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-3/run-local-airflow-environments) is now available in Cloud Composer 3. This tool helps to streamline testing and developing by providing local Airflow environments based on Airflow builds used by Cloud Composer 3.

summary.title: New Local Development CLI for Composer 3
summary.summary: Test and develop Composer 3 workflows faster with the new local development CLI tool. This feature provides local Airflow environments that mirror the builds used by Cloud Composer 3, simplifying your development process.
